greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Array read by antidiagonals where A(n,k) is the number of divisors of n^k.
comment: First differs from A343658 at A(4,2) = 5, A343658(4,2) = 6.
As a triangle, T(n,k) = number of divisors of k^(n-k).
formula: A(n,k) = A000005(A009998(n,k)), where A009998(n,k) = n^k is the interpretation as an array.
example: For example, row n = 8 counts the following divisors:
xref: Column k = 1 of the array is A000005.
Row n = 6 of the array is A000290.
Column k = 2 of the array is A048691.
Diagonal n = k of the array is A062319.
Array antidiagonal sums (row sums of the triangle) are A343657.
A007318 counts k-sets of elements of {1..n}.
A059481 counts k-multisets of elements of {1..n}.
results.author: _Gus Wiseman_, Apr 28 2021
